humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " earth " and " ben ", the original meaning is the uplift of the tomb's closed soil, and later refers to the tomb in general. "Shuowen": "The tomb. From the soil, the sound of the ben." "Book of Rites-On Tan Gong": "The tomb of the ancients is not the tomb." Zheng Xuan's note: "The tomb is called the Zhaoyu domain. It is called Yinshi. The highest earth is called the grave."

" Grave " can mean embankments, waterside highlands. "Poetry ‧ Zhou Nan‧ Ru Tomb": "Follow Biru's tomb, cut down its pieces." Kong Yingda Shu: "Grave, Dafang."

" Grave " also means obedience. "Guan Zi‧ Under the Ruler and the Minister": "Those who rule the axe and yue dare not give punishment, those who rule Xuanmian dare not give rewards, the grave is like the son of a father, if the family is real, righteousness is also clear." Dai Wang's note: "The grave, Favorable appearance. Or punishment and reward, don’t dare to disobey. If the son is from the father, the family is from the elder. That is the reason for the courtesy."

" Grave " also means division. "Songs of the Chu-Heaven Questions": "Hongquan is extremely deep, why is it made of? The nine places, why is the grave?" Wang Fuzhi explained: "Hongquan, flood. Flood, and fill in, stop it. Nine, Kyushu Tian Fu has a nine-level style. Tombs are divided. The words Yu level the water and the soil, and the soil is fixed. What kind of method is used, it is only logical."

" Grave " is also pronounced on the sound, which means the soil is fertile. "Shu‧Yugong": "Juetu black grave." Lu Deming quoted Ma Rongyun in the interpretation: "There is anointing and fat."

The " tomb " in the pronunciation method also means high rise. "Mandarin ‧ Jin Language 2": "Gongzhi, call Shen Gongxian. The place of public sacrifice, the grave." Wei Zhao's note: "Grave, Qi Ye."

humanum_full_description:
從「土」，「賁」聲，本義為墓之封土隆起者，後泛指墳墓。《說文》：「墓也。从土，賁聲。」《禮記‧檀弓上》：「古者墓而不墳。」鄭玄注：「墓，謂兆域，今之封塋也。古，謂殷時也。土之高者曰墳。」

　　「墳」可表示堤岸、水邊高地。《詩‧周南‧汝墳》：「遵彼汝墳，伐其條枚。」孔穎達疏：「墳，大防。」

　　「墳」還表示順從。《管子‧君臣下》：「治斧鉞者不敢讓刑，治軒冕者不敢讓賞，墳然若一父之子，若一家之實，義禮明也。」戴望注：「墳，順貌。或刑賞之，莫敢違逆。若子之從父，家之從長。如此者，禮義明故也。」

　　「墳」亦表示劃分。《楚辭‧天問》：「洪泉極深，何以窴之？地方九則，何以墳之？」王夫之通釋：「洪泉，洪水。窴，與填通，塞也。九則，九州田賦九等之式。墳，分也。言禹平水土，定則壤，用何道也，順其理而已。」

　　「墳」還有上聲讀法，表示土質肥沃。《書‧禹貢》：「厥土黑墳。」陸德明釋文引馬融云：「有膏肥也。」

　　上聲讀法之「墳」也表示高起。《國語‧晉語二》：「公至，召申公獻。公祭之地，地墳。」韋昭注：「墳，起也。」
